sentences.sContent: And actually it damages the pancreas itself, after a while.
sentences.sContent_eng: And actually it damages the pancreas itself, after a while.
sentences.sCn: 事实上，一段时间之后它对胰腺本身也会产生伤害。

sentences.sContent: In people with diabetes, however, the pancreas either produces little or no insulin, or the cells do not respond appropriately to the insulin that is produced.
sentences.sContent_eng: In people with diabetes, however, the pancreas either produces little or no insulin, or the cells do not respond appropriately to the insulin that is produced.
sentences.sCn: 然而，有糖尿病的人，胰腺要么生成一点或根本没有生成胰岛素，或者是细胞没有正确的反应胰腺分泌的胰岛素。

sentences.sContent: The scientists claim the rat stem cells grew in the niche left by the absent mouse pancreas and so almost any organ could be produced in this way.
sentences.sContent_eng: The scientists claim the rat stem cells grew in the niche left by the absent mouse pancreas and so almost any organ could be produced in this way.
sentences.sCn: 科学家们声称大鼠干细胞刚好在小白鼠缺失的胰腺所在位置生长，所以几乎任何器官都可以通过这种方法生成。

trans.tranOther: a  gland  inside your body, near your stomach, that produces  insulin  and a liquid that helps your body to use the food that you eat
